content.webTitle: Tesco gives a little help to nearby bookshop

fields.headline: Tesco gives a little help to nearby bookshop
fields.bodyText: Tesco this week agreed to help out a small independent bookshop after its manager appealed to the supermarket's chief executive, Sir Terry Leahy. Eleanor Davies, who runs the Wirral-based independent bookshop Linghams, got in touch with Leahy after reading an interview in which he expressed guilt about forcing small shops out of business. Davies found Leahy's email address and sent him a message saying that Tesco could help her. The Heswall branch of Tesco now has three signs in its books section advising customers that a wider range of titles is available across the road in Linghams.
